seeds.title: AUREA Healthcheck + Troubleshooting
seeds.content:
Purpose
- Keep Command Center AUREA stable even when upstream LLM providers are rate-limited or temporarily down.

Key Behavior
- Endpoint: POST /aurea/chat/message (requires X-API-Key)
- If message is exactly "Reply with only: pong" (case-insensitive, trimmed), the service returns "pong" deterministically.
- This path does NOT require external LLM calls or database writes.

Provider Ordering (non-stream)
- Anthropic -> Gemini -> Perplexity -> OpenAI (last-resort)

Troubleshooting Checklist
1) Verify AI Agents health: GET /health returns HTTP 200.
2) Verify AUREA health path:
   - POST /aurea/chat/message with {"message":"Reply with only: pong","stream":false} returns pong.
3) If you see "trouble connecting" in the Command Center UI:
   - Confirm BRAINOPS_API_KEY/AGENTS_API_KEY is set in the Command Center environment.
   - Check Render deploy status for AI Agents and ensure it is live.
4) If upstream providers are rate-limited:
   - AUREA should still pass the deterministic healthcheck and keep the UI usable.

seeds.title: Command Center Live Verification (Prod)
seeds.content:
Goal
- Prove production navigation and AUREA UX work end-to-end (no guessing).

Live Nav Sweep
- Run from brainops-command-center/
- Requires: BASE_URL=https://brainops-command-center.vercel.app and BRAINOPS_API_KEY
- Command:
  BASE_URL=https://brainops-command-center.vercel.app RUN_LIVE_SWEEP=true npm run test:e2e -- e2e/live-nav.spec.ts

What It Proves
- Login succeeds
- Sidebar navigation links actually navigate
- Mobile bottom nav works
- AUREA UI receives a response and does not show the "core systems" error string

seeds.title: Weathercraft ERP Prod-Remote E2E Smoke
seeds.content:
Goal
- Validate ERP core workflows against real production (QA automation tenant) without destructive operations.

Command
- Run from weathercraft-erp/
  PLAYWRIGHT_ALLOW_PROD_E2E=1 PLAYWRIGHT_TENANT_ID=497509e7-b9f8-4766-922c-94ed19626547 npm run test:e2e:smoke:remote

Expected Result
- Full smoke suite passes (non-destructive) and confirms auth/session, core module navigation, and workflow integrity.

seeds.title: Deploy AI Agents (Docker -> Render)
seeds.content:
Standard Deploy
- Command:
  brainops deploy ai-agents

What It Does
1) docker build
2) docker push mwwoodworth/brainops-ai-agents:latest
3) Trigger Render deploy for service srv-d413iu75r7bs738btc10
4) Wait for live + run health check

Operational Note
- Render may cancel an API-triggered deploy if an auto-deploy starts immediately after a new image push.
- Always confirm the *latest* deploy is live via Render deploy list and AI Agents /health.

seeds.title: MCP Bridge (Prod) Overview
seeds.content:
Service
- brainops-mcp-bridge (Render web service)

Purpose
- Provide a secured MCP interface for DevOps/automation tools.

Health
- GET /health returns inventory counts (servers/tools) and cache status.

Config
- Uses mcp-config.json at runtime; in Render, local-only servers are automatically disabled.
